Contradict fact: The claim that the 317 area code was assigned as a tribute to the number of survivors of the sinking of the USS Indianapolis contradicts the findings of the expert, who states that there is no substantiated evidence for this belief.
Understate: The claim may understate the lack of support for the connection between the 317 area code and the USS Indianapolis sinking. The expert mentions that neither the Indiana Historical Society nor the Federal Communications Commission found any records related to the reasoning behind the assignment of the 317 area code.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as the expert mentions that there is no substantiated evidence or records to support the belief that the 317 area code was assigned as a tribute to the number of survivors of the USS Indianapolis sinking.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes a connection between the 317 area code and the number of survivors of the USS Indianapolis sinking without sufficient evidence or documentation to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert suggests an alternative explanation for the assignment of the 317 area code, stating that the initial set of area codes were determined based on a rotary phone dialing formula that estimated call volumes for different geographic regions.
